reviewText: I bought this pack mainly for the original Rambo 1 movie disc.  It looked great in high-definition.  I do not understand one reviewer's comment about his aspect ratio problem with the discs.  The movies are displayed with the top and bottom black bars that almost all recent movies have.  Another reviewer says that these Rambo movies, 1 & 4, are the best.  While the first Rambo is one of the best, the 4th Rambo movie is Not!  Rambo 4 is not a bad movie.  It's just not as great as Rambo 1 and 2, and even 3.  In the first 3 Rambo movies, Sylvester Stallone looks young and energetic.  In the 4th Rambo movie, Sylvester Stallone looks old and tired.  I think that in Rambo 4 they tried to compensate the old and tired look with graphic and modern special-effects.  When it comes to the graphic and special-effects scenes, Rambo 4 beats 1, 2, and 3.
summary: Movies simply look better on Blu-ray

reviewText: I'll be honest... I am not a big Rambo fan. While I always enjoyed the original, First Blood, and the newest movie, Rambo, non of the in-between movies are entertaining for me. I have always ran into a three-pack at the stores, which only include the first three, so why pay for two movies I have no interest in?After reading a short review from blu-ray dot com, I'd agree that the picture is never very bright, but it is part of the film style since much takes place at night and in the woods. There's no overly done artificial noise reduction BS taking place to smooth out the film grain, so the images has plenty of detail for an older film. The surround sound I don't remember jumping out at me as a phenomenal experience, just average. Or if I had to rate it maybe I'd classify it as "like the rest and not a tick better."So, if you're like me, and you only want to watch and own the "good" Rambo's... THIS is the combo pack for you!
summary: The Only Rambo Movies You Really Need!

reviewText: The Blu-ray technology in these Legends Two-Packs is diminished to an aspect ratio of 1.33:1.  VERY BAD MOVE.  If you really are interested in maximizing the image then don't miss out on 50% of the movie, which is what you loose with these two packs.  Learn from my mistake - Buy once, buy right, buy something not this.
summary: Very bad choice using Blu-ray technology

reviewText: I don't know what issue the other person had with this two-pack is, but both films are presented in Widescreen. As far as I know, there is not yet a single case where a "pan and scan" or a reformatted "full screen" aspect ratio as the feature presentation on any Blu-Ray (at least not by a major studio), and there are an EXTREMELY limited number of cases where a full-screen version is also included in addition to the widescreen feature (excluding, of course, films that were shot and are meant to be presented in full screen from the '40s and earlier).In any case, this is just the two existing RAMBO and FIRST BLOOD Blu-rays in a single case. All the same extras, same presentation, etc. It is also the theatrical presentation of RAMBO and not the Director's Cut.
summary: In response to the other review...
Title: N/A
